intro: Mikania pycnadenia, commonly known as the denseleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shady habitats such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Mikania pycnadenia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
